Title: Salesforce Consultant - Contract (Contract)
Description:
Salesforce Consultant - Contract (Contract)

Our Client is looking for a Salesforce Cloud Consultant to join their team on a six-month initial contract. The Salesforce Cloud Consultant will be responsible for configuring and delivering world-class CRM solutions for customers, producing enterprise standard technology product and for working with the delivery teams to build and deliver them successfully on the Salesforce platform.

You will be working for a growing organization who have a huge amount of career opportunities. There is a very collaborative environment both within the team and across functions.

Primary responsibilities include:

  • Configuration and customisation of the Platform
  • Strong configuration experience - workflows, apex triggers, validation rules and process flows
  • Understanding of Apex code (No hands-on coding needed)
  • Provide Subject Matter Expertise in Cloud Architecture
  • Perform root cause analysis and troubleshoot systems & interfaces
  • User adoption and training
  • Conduct and lead requirement gathering sessions
  • Authoring functional/technical design documents
  • Managing the technical delivery of integrations and custom extensions
  • Providing hands on expert level assistance to developers on technical issues
  • Good implementation experience - Service and Sales cloud
  • Creating reports and dashboards
  • Liaise closely with the technical teams
  • Good communication skills

Requirements:

  • Experience of working in a faced paced environment
  • Extensive hands-on experience with Salesforce Cloud
  • Integration experience
  • Strong API Skills and SQL

If you able to work freely within the UK and would like to discuss this in more detail, then please apply here.


Posted Date: 22 Feb 2018 Reference: JSDP/UK-44100 Employment Business: DANEM PEOPLE Technical Recruitment Ltd Contact: Kevin Meyer

Title: Excel VBA Developer/Consultant (Contract)
Description:
Excel VBA Developer/Consultant (Contract)

An exclusive role and a fantastic opportunity with one of our clients.

Technical skills required for this role:

- MS Excel Expert - Familiar with the Excel Object Model.

- Experience with MS SQL Server

- Experience with writing advanced VBA

- Experience working in a Rapid Application Development (RAD) team

- Experience with 3rd party libraries such as Bloomberg, Reuters

- Understands the nuances of Excel versions between 2003 - 2016

The following experience/skill-set is desired to be successful:

- Problem solver, comfortable taking the initiative in challenging and ambiguous circumstances

- Systematic approach to both support and development

- Friendly, approachable and collaborative team player who enjoys working with people from across the firm

- Continuous improvement mind-set, challenges the status quo and seeks self improvement

- Capable of remaining positive when under pressure

- Excellent technical and investigatory analysis skills.

This is an initial 6-month contract with likelihood of extension. Our client, a Large financial institution based in Central London, is embarking on a large-scale MS Office migration.

The primary role will be testing the integrity of existing Excel spreadsheets to make sure they are compliant based on the company's internal EUC policy and ensure all business-critical files are compatible in office 2016. The individual will need the skills to be able to remediate any compatibility issues or poorly designed/built spreadsheets.

You will be working with the internal IT teams as well as the end users. Whilst remediating spreadsheets, you will need to be able to develop tactical spreadsheet solutions that will be used as prototypes prior to the firm developing internally developed solutions. There may also be requests for ad-hoc spreadsheet automation.

Proprietary tools will be provided to analyse the spreadsheets and overall usage behaviour to improve the migration process.

Please send your CV if you are interested in the role.

Market Risk Data Analyst (Contract)

Job Title: Market Risk Data Analyst

Location: London, UK

Duration: 6 months+

Start Date: Immediate

Daily Rate: £350 to £400 per day

Experience: Minimum 8 years of experience.

Key Accountabilities:
Refining the logical design so it can be translated to the data model
Provide technical and functional knowledge to support other staff members within the organization
Interact with internal/external team members throughout the application life cycle
Gather and document business requirements from business users as necessary.
Manage builds and migrations between various staging environments
Monitor and maintain application security and integrity
Tune and monitor reporting application performance
Maintain code automated SQL Pipeline build process
Manage code within Team Foundation Server source control system
3rd line support of production systems including analysis and troubleshooting of problems
Assist with release or change management process
Document and provide knowledge transition to other team members

Essential Experience:
Reporting and data analysis skills
Data Mappings
MS SQL Server or Oracle databases
ETL (Informatica or SSIS)
Microsoft SSAS and/or reporting tools (SSRS, Power BI, Business Objects)
Cloudera Data Lake (Impala, Hive, Hadoop)
Experience working in an Agile teams
Background in creating design documentation (eg data catalog)
Effective and clear communicator
High self-motivation and strong delivery focus
Intellectual curiosity, creativity and passion for professional software development.
Experience with programs of work migrating Data Analytics/Reporting platform to the Big Data solutions
Experience with large-scale enterprise wide IT environments containing multiple technologies, Servers and logical environments
Demonstrates evidence of project completion including transition to support in an enterprise environment
Experience with enterprise project life cycle
Experience with Change and Release Management
Application of best practices to ensure quality and accuracy of project deliverables

Desirable criteria & qualifications
Understanding of Commodities (Oil, Gas, Power, LNG) finance
Knowledge of end-to-end (Front to Back Office) business processes in financial trading & risk environment.
Understanding of Datamodelling and data Warehousing principles
Database unit-test and integration test experience with automated testing frameworks and tools such as SpecFlow and tSQLt
Experience with Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence/Analysis tooling (SSAS, SSRS)
Experience with Informatica's Big Data Manager and Intelligent Data Lake
Understanding of other Big Data tools and technologies (eg Python, Spark, Sqoop)
Working in the Cloud environment (AWS or Azure)
Understand Service Oriented Architectures, Web Services, and Design Patterns
Experience with software development life cycle (SDLC), Agile (SCRUM) processes, and source control and build tools (TFS, Clearcase, Subversion, Jenkins, Nant, Ant, Maven).

Posted Date: 22 Feb 2018 Reference: JS-62975 Employment Business: Reed Technology Contact: Rameen Hasan

Title: Data Migration Analyst - Contract (Contract)
Description:
Data Migration Analyst - Contract (Contract)

Job Title: Data Migration Analyst - Contract

Location: London

Salary: £300-£400 per day

About The Company looking for a Data Migration Analyst:

My client has a unique opportunity for a skilled and knowledgeable Data Migration Analyst to join their team in a 6 month contract position (with possibility for extension). The company works within the Public Sector and they are looking for a Data Analyst contractor to assist in their large-scale data migration project. If you are looking to add valuable experience to your portfolio as a Data Migration Analyst then this is the ideal position for you.

About The Data Migration Analyst Role:

As a Data Migration Analyst, you will be utilising ETL processes to integrate large amounts of data from various sources into a newly-constructed data warehouse.

Your Key Responsibilities will be:

  • Create a comprehensive migration strategy document that adheres to business requirements
  • Extract data from several platforms using ETL tools
  • Run tests to ensure the quality of data is not compromised during the transformation process
  • Create detailed specifications of data mapping and transformation procedures
  • Effectively load data into DWH and utilise data cleansing techniques to eliminate errors
  • Ensure all data policies comply with GDPR guidelines

About The Successful Data Migration Analyst:

The successful Data Migration Analyst will not only be technically skilled but will have the ability to communicate their processes to non-technical colleagues.

The Desired Skills and Competencies of the Data Migration Analyst are:

  • Over 4 years of experience in Back End Data Analyst positions
  • Excellent knowledge of SQL and ETL tools
  • Hands-on experience with data cleansing, mapping and transformation procedures
  • Experience of cloud-based platforms
  • Knowledge of GDPR guidelines

The Data Migration Analyst role will be offered a highly competitive wage paying from £300 - £400 per day depending on experience.

For more information about the Data Migration Analyst role or to apply send your CV now to (see below) Apply soon before the position is filled!

Posted Date: 22 Feb 2018 Reference: JSLLOYD'S MARKET Employment Business: Empiric Solutions Contact: Diego Baynes

Title: Infrastructure Delivery Architect (Contract)
Description:
Infrastructure Delivery Architect (Contract)

Based in London or Wimbledon

6 months+ contract

Immediate start

£500 daily rate

IDPP is currently recruiting for an Infrastructure Architect for a large financial firm based in London.

Key responsibilities:

  • Act as a technical subject matter expert in the Core Close Brothers Infrastructure technologies.
  • Manage the entire project life cycle of technical/infrastructure solution designs.
  • Engage with relevant 3rd parties and advise on technical assessments of 3rd parties
  • Establish both baseline and target state requirements so as to demonstrate how recommended infrastructure solutions meet the business requirements and add value.
  • Create and develop high-level Infrastructure Architecture documents in line with current standards for new projects and upgrades.
  • Identify existing unleveraged infrastructure capability for re/use and optimization
  • Assist engineering teams to create and update all project documentation relating to the low level design, ensuring adherence to both IT architecture and high-level design principles.
  • Troubleshoot and problem solve during project development & test prior to implementation
  • Assist in the creation of workflows, knowledgebase articles, training and operational support processes to ensure smooth transition into service management
  • Deliver to agreed timescales and costs
  • Assist in technical performance assessments.
  • Contribute to all research and development activities.
  • Maintain an awareness of emerging technologies and trends

Skills and experience:

Essential:

  • The successful candidate will possess an in depth understanding & experience of infrastructure technologies & proven track record of architecting solutions.
  • Experience of translating business requirements into technical high level designs.
  • Able to produce detailed technical specifications and documentation.

In depth technical Skills in the following technologies:

  • VMWare and Virtualisation technologies
  • Windows Server/Desktop platforms and technologies.
  • Middleware technologies eg IBM Integration Bus, MS Biztalk, SAP PI, MQ and JMS messaging.
  • JBOSS and other Application Server technologies.
  • Local and Wide area networks
  • Experience of designing/building Application, Web (including Apache/Tomcat, IIS) and Database Servers.
  • Storage SAN/NAS

Desirable

  • SQL and Oracle Database Technologies
  • Linux (Red Hat preferred)
  • Telephony (Cisco Preferred)

In addition to the technical skills detailed above, the candidate should be able to demonstrate:

  • Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively with IT and non-IT staff at all levels.
  • Analytical thinker, and experienced problem solver.
  • Have an excellent eye for detail.
  • Mindfulness of User Experience and supportability focusing on simplicity and ease of use
  • Commercially astute.
  • Strong interpersonal, presentation and negotiation skills.
  • Strong communication skills - both verbal and written.
  • Be proactive, driven and have the ability to work both in team and independently without supervision.
  • Planning and time management skills
  • Exposure to working within a structured ITIL environment

Desirable:

  • Understand the methods and techniques associated with planning and monitoring of projects.
  • Have experience of prototyping or proof of concept exercises to valid and evaluate the benefits of applying a particular technology to a business need.
  • Be familiar with Risk Management and Service Management frameworks.

If this is of interest please apply today!

Title: Database Developer - SQL/SSIS Developer (Contract)
Description:
Database Developer - SQL/SSIS Developer (Contract)

Database Developer - SQL/SSIS Developer

City, London

Contract - 6 months

Daily Rate - £450/day

SQL/T-SQL/Data Integration/Informatica/SSIS/ETL/Data Warehouse/SQL Server

My client is a leading Lloyd's of London insurer who are seeking a hands-on Database Developer to join their team. This role will be London based, with possible ad-hoc visits to Guilford as and when required.

The role

To support the current development team with a focus on the analysis and hands-on development of SQL based systems and Data Marts. The post holder will be required to support the integrations with multiple systems, ensuring accuracy and quality of data by implementing business and technical reconciliations.

The role will entail hands on development and maintenance of the SQL based systems and various associated components for data ingestion, transformation and processing. Providing development and maintenance of integrations with various Financial, Underwriting and Claims Management Systems.

To be considered for this contract role, applicants must have a minimum 5 years or more experience in a development role handling Data/SQL Integration Projects.

Experience Required

  • Ensuring data quality and accuracy by implementing business and technical reconciliations via scripts, profiling and data analysis.
  • Develop and support objects and code for data profiling, extraction, load and updates.
  • Provide and maintain documentation for all developed objects and processes.
  • Integration testing of deliverables.
  • Develop and run test scripts to ensure the quality of code and integrity.
  • Use source code control repository (using VSTS)
  • Following data/integration design patterns and architecture as prescribed by the Architects.
  • Possess and demonstrate deep knowledge of data warehouse concepts, techniques, various design alternatives, and overall data warehouse strategies.

Technical Skill requirements

  • SQL server database objects (Stored Procedures, Triggers, Views etc.)
  • T-SQL Query Optimization with Indexes.
  • SSIS integration tasks.
  • Enterprise data warehouse implementation using SSIS and SQL Server Objects.
  • ETL Code/Integration using Informatica.
  • Type 2 Dimension Data model and data warehouse ETL techniques for historical data.
  • Data Mapping and Low Level/ETL Design Documentation.

SQL/T-SQL/Data Integration/Informatica/SSIS/ETL/Data Warehouse/SQL Server

Database Developer - SQL/SSIS Developer

City, London

Contract - 6 months

Daily Rate - £450/day

Title: Data Engineer (Hive, Hadoop) - Urgent! (Contract)
Description:
Data Engineer (Hive, Hadoop) - Urgent! (Contract)

Cloud Consulting have an urgent requirement for an experienced Data Engineer to join a transformation programme with a leading financial services group. This will be working in the Data Science team which applies advanced data science methods to key business problems and opportunities. The teams are tasked with identifying opportunities for analytics across the business, to rapidly build machine learning prototypes and to engineer production quality software of data systems and machine learning.

To be suitable, you should have the following experience:

HIVE/SQL - Optimisation performance - familiarity with partitioning, bucketing, indexing etc.

Hadoop - ie kafka, storm, Spark, oozie etc,

Datamodelling - Knowledge of Datamodelling within an Enterprise data warehouse/Big Data environment. ie denomalised views, star schemas, third-normal form, OLAP cubes etc

Data quality + lineage - ensuring the quality of data is governance and documented in accordance with Group-wide standards.

Machine Learning, stats, modelling etc - knowledge of the practical application of these techniques is required, but the ability to build a model is not.

If this is of interest, please forward your C.V ASAP with an indication of rate and availability.

Title: IT Technical Lead (Contract)
Description:
IT Technical Lead (Contract)

We have a fantastic opportunity for an IT Technical Lead to join a growing professional services firm (c. 5000 users) based in the City Of London. Reporting into the Programme Lead the IT Technical Lead will be responsible for the documenting the required technical solution & integrations for the programme and be a key point of contact for the project in navigating the technical side o delivery. They will be responsible for coordinating test environment requests, representing the project in technical review boards as well as change boards. This role ensures that the technical solution aligns to the original design, and is the key liaison with technical architects and IT strategy.

Key Accountabilities

  • Reporting to IT Programme lead, and where relevant associated project manager.
  • Creating High and Low-Level Designs to go to the Architectural Review Board for approval.
  • Representing these designs at Architectural Review Board
  • Supporting the Developers from conceptual design through to development process.
  • Ability to assist in the estimating process.
  • Managing test environment requirements
  • Raising & representing Change Requests at the Change Advisory Board Point of contact for technical queries relating to the project delivery, and responsible for resolving these

Essential Skills

  • Has created High and Low level technical design documents previously
  • Worked in Agile and Waterfall environments
  • Has hands-on knowledge and strong SQL experience & knowledge
  • Knowledge of .Net
  • Lead in designing, specifying and selecting information system solutions, considering functionality, data, security,
  • integration, infrastructure and performance.
  • Understand and support to software architecture design and support development team in developing solutions
  • Has lead implementation Project Team members and ensures they are supported and receive clear directions on function and design of information systems.
  • Experienced in assessing a broad range of information solutions and products particularly document management, collaboration and content management.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to lay audiences. Some experience of with working with stakeholders.
  • Team player with experience leading and collaborating cross-team to ensure successful delivery of solutions.
  • Strong conceptual and analytical skills - demonstrating outside-the-box problem-solving skills
  • Working knowledge of infrastructure including Servers, storage, Firewalls, load, balancers, Routers, etc.
